resources.string:
Enterococcus, Staphylococcus, & Streptococcus. 

VR = Vancomycin Resistant Enterococcus 
MR = Methicillin-Resistant Staph. Aureus

Community Infections 
GI = Proteus, E. Coli, & Klebsiella - "PEK" 
Resp = Haemophilus influenzae, & Moraxella 

Nosocomial Infections 
SPACE(M) = Serratia, Providencia, Acinetobacter, Citrobacter, Enterobacter, & Morganella. 
Pseudo. = Pseudomonas Aeruginosa (water)

Head/Neck anaerobes: 
Bacteroides (fragilis), Veillonella, Bifidobacteria, Peptococcus, Peptostreptococcus, & Propionibacterium 
Lower anaerobes: (More virulent with more resistance) 
Bacteroides (non-fragilis), Prevotella, Clostridium
Legionella - older patients\nChlamydia - younger patients \nMycoplasma - younger patients

Oxacillin (IV) 
Nafcillin (IV) 
Dicloxacillin (PO) 

HEPATIC ELIMINATION 
Coag(-) staph. is generally resistant (>80%)

Augmentin (Amoxicillin/Clavulanate) (PO) 

Unasyn only covers acinetobacter (SPACE) 
Rising e. coli resistance 
*Only treats H/N anaerobes

Zosyn (Piperacillin/Tazobactam) (IV) 

Poor activity versus coag(-) staph. 
*Can treat lower anaerobes

Cefazolin (IV) "Ancef" 
Cephalexin (PO) 

Cefazolin can be used in penicillin allergy 
Cefazolin has some G(+) coverage for prophylaxis

Cefuroxime (PO,IV) 
Cefotetan (IV) 
Cefoxitin (IV) 

Cefuroxime gains h. flu, enterobacter, neisseria 
Cefotetan & Cefoxitin are cephamycins 
Cefotetan & Cefoxitin lack G(+) coverage

Ceftriaxone (IV) "Rocephin" 
Cefotaxime (IV) 
Cefpodoxime (PO) 
Cefdinir (PO) 
Cefixime (PO) 
Ceftazidime (IV) *Antipseudomonal activity 

NO RENAL ADJUSTMENT (Ceftriaxone only) 

Ceftazidime lacks G(+) cover 
Ceftriaxone penetrates CSF 
Avoid Ceftriaxone if low AmpC lactamase levels

Cefepime (IV) 

Avoid use with mid/high AmpC levels 
Low cross-react with penicillin allergy
Ceftaroline (IV) \n\n*Often reserved for refractory MRSA or VRSA

Zerbaxa (Ceftolozane/Tazobactam) (IV) 
Avycaz (Ceftazidime/Avibactam) (IV) 

Limited FDA-approved indications 
Avycaz can be used for ESBL & CRE (KPC only) 
Zerbaxa can be used for ESBL

Meropenem (IV) 
Imipenem/Cilastatin (IV) 
Ertapenem (IV) 
Doripenem (IV) 

*Often reserved for ESBL (DOC) 
*Can treat lower anaerobes 
May cause seizures (Imipenem/Cilastatin more than others) 
Ertapenem lacks acinetobacter coverage 

Cilastatin px imipenem breakdown

Amikacin (IV,IM) 
Gentamicin (IV,IM) 
Tobramycin (IV,IM) 

Causes nephrotoxicity 
*Can use low dose w/ beta-lactam for G(+) synergy

Levofloxacin (IV,PO) 
Ciprofloxacin (IV,PO) 
Moxifloxacin (IV,PO) 

May cause QT-prolongation (M>C>L) 
*Moxi. does not concentrate in the urine well 
*Moxi only treats H/N anaerobes
Separate dosing from polyvalent cations

Azithromycin (PO,IV) 
Clarithormycin (PO) 

BACTERIOSTATIC 

Causes QT prolongation 
Distributes rapidly/well to tissue, but not blood

Doxycycline (IV,PO) 
Minocycline (IV,PO) 

BACTERIOSTATIC 

Take with water to px esophagitis 
Separate dosing from polyvalent cations

Vancomycin (IV,PO) 
Dalbavancin, Oritavancin, Televancin (IV) 

High Trough Goal: Endocarditis, OM/PJI, ICU HCAP/sepsis & MRSA (MIC=1) 
Very High Trough Goal: Meningitis/CNS Infections 

Causes nephrotoxicity 
PO formulation for c. diff only (DOC) 
Prevent Red Man Synd. by slowing infusion 

-Vancins cover G(+) anaerobes
Oritavancin covers VRE

Linezolid (IV,PO) 
Tedizolid (IV,PO) -reserved for resistance 

BACTERIOSTATIC (except strep. sp) 

Causes myelosuppression with prolonged use (>2w) 
May cause serotonin syndrome

Clindamycin (IV,PO) 

BACTERIOSTATIC 

CA: Covers community acquired-MRSA 
*Only treats H/N anaerobes

Tigecycline (IV) 

HEPATIC METABOLISM
BACTERIOSTATIC (Except strep. pneumo & listeria) 

Used primarily for G(-) coverage 
Lacks Proteus, Providencia, & Pseudomonas coverage 
Can treat Acinetobacter if MIC<lt4
Potentially effective for nosocomial MRSA 

*Does not concentrate well in blood or urine 
Concentrates well in lung & abdomen 

Covers ESBL & CRE if desperate 
BBW: Increase in all-cause mortality

TMP/SMX (PO, IV) 

CA: Covers community acquired-MRSA 
SULFA DRUG 
Dosed based on TMP component 
Does not concentrate in the blood well 
Causes hyperkalemia & pseudo-sCr elevation 

DOC: Stenotrophomonas Maltophilia
Are you sure you wish to delete ALL comment files?

> Regarding The Application:


-> Scrolling: 
—> Users can scroll up & down in the chart & as well as in the popups.


-> Clicking: 
—> Almost all of the graphics in this app are image buttons that the user can press. Once pressed the corresponding popup will display itself.


> Regarding The Buttons At The Bottom:


-> 'Delete All Comments': 
—> This button will delete all of the user comments that they have saved throughout the use of the app resetting the comments to the default.


-> 'Disable Comments': 
—> This button will hide any comments that the user has made or the default values, as well as the edit comment button. The button shows what will happen when you click on it. 
——> E.G. if it says 'Disable Comments', when clicked it will then disable the comments.


-> 'Help Figuring This Out': 
—> This button shows a WIP guide of how to use this app. It will continue to change according to the feedback that the users give.


-> 'About ABX Spectrum': 
\—> This button gives a brief description of the developers & the intended use for this application.

>About this App: 
-> Target Audience: 
—> Pharmacy students. 
-> This is a mobile application that covers the types of bacteria, the header of the chart, & the corresponding antibiotics that should be used to combat them, the bottom of the chart. 
-> This application should be considered useful to pharmacy students & those that would like to know about antibiotic coverage against bacteria.


> This application was commissioned by Thomas Gintjee & Rozhan Sadr.


> Team: 
-> Matthew Gintjee: Code 
-> Thomas Gintjee: Graphics, Content 
-> Rozhan Sadr: Content


> Changelog:


->Version 1.14 ( Current ): 
—> Reformatted the Help about this app to look prettier. 
—> Hide the android navigation bar. 
——> The black bar at the bottom of the screen that has a triangle, circle, and square.


->Version 1.13: 
—> Updated all string with '&' in place of 'and'. 
—> Reformatted the changelog to look prettier. 
—> Reformatted the About this app to look prettier.


->Version 1.12: 
—> Added Changelog to the About popup 
—> Enabled the app to rotate when device rotates


-> Version 1.11: 
—> Fixed ABOUT popup's format to match the other popups 
—> Reformatted HELP's text to be more clear ( Hopefully )


-> Version 1.10: 
—> Added 4 Buttons at the bottom of the chart. 
——> "Delete All Comments" 
————> Resets all of the user comments to "Empty" when pressed & the user confirms the dialog. 
——> "Disable\Enable Comments" 
————> Enables the user to choose whether or not the comments are displayed. 
————> The button shows WHAT WILL HAPPEN when the user presses the button. 
——> "Help Figuring This Out" 
————> A very basic guide to the application. 
——> "About ABX Spectrum" 
————> Gives a very brief description of the application. 
————> Contains the changelog, & the development team information.


-> Version 1.9: 
—> Enabled users to have their own local comments regarding any of the popups 
——> While in a popup activity, there is a new button on the bottom right of the screen, clicking this will call a dialog to either save a new comment or cancel the dialog 
—> Added Button at bottom of chart that will delete all of the user comment files, replacing them with the default ones 
—> Reformatted code to be more modular, but in theory should have same performance


-> Version 1.8 ( Skipped 1.6 & 1.7 due to issues uploading APK ): 
—> Modified popups so that the title text & the description text are closer


-> Version 1.5: 
—> Changed "Dismiss" from circle shape to square shape 
—> Updated Gram positive, gram negative, & atypical images


-> Version 1.4: 
—> Updated ALL Images, thanks to T. Gintjee 
—> Formatted popup to reduce any overlap between text(s) & dismiss button ( Unless the screen is super small ) 
—> Organized code to be far prettier than what it used to be 
——> Now the popups use a popup template that is modified by which button you click. Not that anyone will be able to notice.


-> Version 1.3: 
—> Updated/Corrected description text in a few popups 
—> Updated images: 5G, Mac, & Car 
—> Updated dismiss button


-> Version 1.2: 
—> Fixed bug where Clin would have Dap popup


-> Version 1.1: 
—> Added Extra new-lines to the ends of text to allow more visibility


-> Version 1.0: 
—> Moved Dismiss Button to Bottom Right 
—> Text Boxes are scroll-able from the entire space below title
